author: ZoeMacUser
title: Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000
text: 2019-05-15 04:53 PM 2019-05-15 04:53 PM Model: R7000|AC1900 Smart WIFI Router Message 2019-05-15 04:53 PM 2019-05-15 04:53 PM Message 2019-05-15 07:49 PM 2019-05-15 07:49 PM Hi Message 2019-05-16 03:08 AM 2019-05-16 03:08 AM Firmware Version Message 2019-05-16 07:41 PM 2019-05-16 07:41 PM Message 2019-05-26 10:33 AM 2019-05-26 10:33 AM Message 2019-05-27 05:29 PM 2019-05-27 05:29 PM Message 2019-05-28 03:09 PM 2019-05-28 03:09 PM Message Aspirant 2024-01-25 01:44 PM 2024-01-25 01:44 PM Message Announcements â€¢ â€¢ Yes! WiFi 7 is backwards compatible with other Wifi devices? [Reply](/t5/forums/replypage/board-id/en-home-networking-apps/message-id/9513) [Topic Options](#) [Subscribe to RSS Feed](/ejquo23388/rss/message?board.id=en-home-networking-apps&message.id=16259) - - Mark Topic as New - Mark Topic as Read - - Float this Topic for Current User - Bookmark - Subscribe - [Printer Friendly Page](/t5/forums/forumtopicprintpage/board-id/en-home-networking-apps/message-id/16259/print-single-message/false/page/1) Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 The new Nighthawk App on iOS appears, to me, to be useless. It launches, it sees and connects to my router, but then no matter what I try to do next I get stuck with the whirling circles of endless wait. For example, the app opens, connects, and I see the menu choices and tap WiFi Settings. I can see the WiFi settings in the "background," and they're all correct, but all that happens then is two little circles spinning inside one another on the screen. I've given it up to five minutes, and then killed the app. No matter what I choose inside the app, same thing. Whirling circles. Sometimes when I reopen the app it can no longer connect to the router at all, as if the first attempt did something to the router itself. I have to then reboot the router manually for the app to even see it, even though it's functioning (all my devices have internet access). Anyone else having this problem? Is there something wrong with the app or with my router? Firmware is up to date as of yesterday, but maybe there's an issue with the latest firmware? Attaching a short video showing the main menu and then what happens when I try to go to WiFi settings. [1](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1751741#M9513)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Video would not upload. [2](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1751742#M9514)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Hi [@ZoeMacUser](/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/679428), welcome to the community! Please try re-installing the app and check if the issue will persist. Also, doe the issue occur when using another device (another iOS or Android)? Please indicate the exact firmware version of the router. Dexter [3](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1751798#M9521)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Copy. Reinstalling the app just now made no difference in the behavior. Everything is exactly the same. Firmware Version V1.0.9.64_10.2.64 [4](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1751920#M9524)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Hi, thanks for responding. I've sent you a message. Please check your inbox. Dexter [5](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1752358#M9533)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Hello, I'm having a nearly identical issue with the app (iOS) with the R7800. It's new, and I went through the set up (giving temporary names and passwords to everything just to get through the process thinking I could change them later) and immediately got caught in the endless cycle of waiting for it to communicate, with the added complication of the router disconnecting from the internet. It locked up during the firmware check so I have no idea if that worked. I deleted the app, rebooted everything, immediately had internet access. Thinking everything sorted out I downloaded the app again, tried to connect - right back into endless cycling and the internet connection dropped. Did this a few more times changing the order, etc - end result I'm online and everything is great as long as I don't open the app. The second the app detects the router the router drops internet and then the app goes into the endless little circle swirling. Right now I have no way of communicating with the router to change any settings or monitor it or anything. Technically it's working. I have internet access. I suppose the silver lining is I didn't pick too silly of a temporary SSID during set up? Help? Suggestions? If I can't get the app to work is there really anything I can do? [6](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1756521#M9570)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 [7](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1757010#M9590)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 Thank you for the response. I did check the firmware version (thanks for the reminder link) and it's all up to date. I ended up buying a new modem. The modem from my ISP wasn't great and once a new one was in place I was able to get the router to step through the update [edit: I meant registration not update] process without the app locking up. End result - we are online, and have more control and I have limited use of the app. It (the app) still behaves as if I haven't registered the router and I have to dimiss the request to setup but other wise it works, sort of. Basically I can see the devices and that it's online. Beyond that it goes into endless cycling. This is much better than before where just opening the app crashed the router, so, yay progress! At this point I'm just going to use the admin login on my computer if I want to do anything fancy and pretend the app doesn't exsist. ðŸ™‚ Thanks for your help! [8](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/1757466#M9597)of 9 Re: Nighthawk App (iOS) Useless - Cannot Access Settings on R7000 I'm trying to access advanced settings on my R7000 through the Nighthawk app (ver. 2.32.1.14 firmware version: v1.0.11.100). I want to be able to block and unblock attached devices but it only shows what is connected under device manager, no way to change anything. This app is worthless unless you can remotely change router settings. Is it even possible? [9](/t5/Nighthawk-App/Nighthawk-App-iOS-Useless-Cannot-Access-Settings-on-R7000/m-p/2359201#M16259)of 9 â€¢ What is the difference between WiFi 6 and WiFi 7? â€¢ Yes! WiFi 7 is backwards compatible with other Wifi devices? Learn more

author: News Direct
title: "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS: The Chronicles of Ezekielâ€™s Riders" - A Journey of Faith and Service Launches This Easter Sunday
text:
Recent Quotes View Full List My Watchlist Create Watchlist Indicators Industrial Estimate Composite Estimate 500 Stocks Estimate Gold Crude Oil Markets Stocks ETFs Tools Overview News Currencies International Treasuries "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS: The Chronicles of Ezekielâ€™s Riders" - A Journey of Faith and Service Launches This Easter Sunday By: News Direct March 29, 2024 at 09:00 AM EDT --News Direct--
This Easter Sunday , as we celebrate the resurrection and the promise of renewal, Great Commission United is thrilled to announce the release of "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS: The Chronicles of Ezekielâ€™s Riders." This compelling new book, authored by Joseph Palumbo and William Hodge, is a testament to the power of faith, the strength of the human spirit, and the profound impact of serving others in the name of Christ.
In a world craving hope and spiritual nourishment, "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS" arrives as a beacon of light. The book chronicles the journey of the Ezekiel Riders, a group of chaplains committed to fulfilling the Great Commission through acts of service and discipleship across the globe. From the streets of local communities to the far reaches of the world, their mission is a powerful reminder of the impact one can make when led by faith and compassion.
About the Authors:
Joseph Palumbo is a dedicated servant leader whose life has been a testament to the transformative power of faith and service. With over five decades of ministry, Joseph's journey from a U.S. Military Police officer to a founder of a coffee shop ministry showcases his unwavering commitment to helping those in need.
William Hodge's path from aspiring police officer to a beacon of hope and restoration underscores the remarkable ways in which faith can change lives. William's divine encounter at a young age set him on a lifelong mission to spread the message of salvation and healing, culminating in his leadership of Great Commission United Chaplaincy and Discipleship Academy.
He Has Risen, Hallelujah:
Launching on Easter Sunday, "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS" is not just a book release; it's an invitation to be part of a movement that echoes the message of Easter - renewal, hope, and the promise of new life. As we commemorate the resurrection, let this book inspire you to rise above challenges, serve with love, and embark on your own journey of faith.
Be Part of the Journey:
Join Joseph Palumbo, William Hodge, and the Ezekiel Riders in their mission to spread the Gospel and serve those in need. "KNEELING ON BROKEN GLASS" is now available at www.kneelingonbrokenglass.com . Purchase your copy today, share your story, and discover how you can make a difference in the world, one act of faith at a time.
For more information, to request a review copy, or to schedule an interview with the authors, please contact riders@kneelingonbrokenglass.com .
Website: www.kneelingonbrokenglass.com
